member.name: N:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX
member.summary: This namespace provides Microsoft DirectX application programming for Pocket PCs, Smartphones, and other devices running Windows CE with the .NET Compact Framework. This namespace is required to implement the namespace.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Device.Clear(Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.ClearFlags,System.Drawing.Color,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Clears the viewport or a set of rectangles in the viewport to a specified RGBA color, clears the depth buffer, and erases the stencil buffer.
member.param: An integer value to store in each stencil-buffer entry. This parameter can be in the range of 0 through 2n-1, where n is the bit depth of the stencil buffer.
A object that represents the color to which the render target surface is cleared.

A few zdepth value that this method stores in the depth buffer. This parameter can be in the range of 0.0 through 1.0 (for z-based or w-based depth buffers). A value of 0.0 represents the nearest distance to the viewer; a value of 1.0 represents the farthest distance.

The flags that indicate which surfaces to clear. This parameter can be any combination of the following flags, but at least one flag must be used:: Clears the stencil buffer to the value in the stencil parameter.: Clears the render target to the color in the color parameter.: Clears the depth buffer to the value in the zdepth parameter.
member.exception: The method call is invalid. For example, a parameter might contain an invalid value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter
member.summary: Defines texture filtering modes for a texture stage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.Box
member.summary: Each pixel is computed by averaging a 2x2(x2) box of pixels from the source image. This filter works only when the dimensions of the destination are half those of the source, as is the case with mipmaps.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.Linear
member.summary: Bilinear interpolation filtering is used as a texture magnification or minification filter. A weighted average of a 2x2 area of texels surrounding the desired pixel is used. The texture filter to use between mipmap levels is trilinear mipmap interpolation. The rasterizer interpolates pixel color in a linear manner, using the texels of the two nearest textures.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.Mirror
member.summary: Same as specifying the and flags. This flag is always used internally for this function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.MirrorU
member.summary: Pixels off the edge of the texture on the u-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.MirrorV
member.summary: Pixels off the edge of the texture on the v-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.None
member.summary: Mipmapping disabled. The rasterizer uses the magnification filter instead.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.Point
member.summary: Each destination pixel is computed by sampling the nearest pixel from the source image.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.FontQuality
member.summary: Specifies the level of font quality.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.FontQuality.AntiAliased
member.summary: Text is rendered using the antialiasing method when possible. The font quality is given less importance than maintaining the text size.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.FontQuality.ClearType
member.summary: Text is rendered using the Microsoft ClearType antialiasing method when possible. The font quality is given less importance than maintaining the text size.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.FontQuality.Default
member.summary: The font appearance does not matter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.FontQuality.Draft
member.summary: The font appearance is given less importance than when the Proof value is used. Scaling is enabled for Microsoft Windows Graphics Device Interface (GDI) raster fonts, which means that more font sizes are available, but their quality might be lower. Bold, italic, underline, and strikeout fonts are synthesized if necessary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.FontQuality.NonAntiAliased
member.summary: The font is never antialiased.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format
member.summary: Defines various types of surface formats.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.A1R5G5B5
member.summary: A 16-bit pixel format that reserves 5 bits for each color and 1 bit for alpha.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.A4R4G4B4
member.summary: A 16-bit ARGB pixel format that uses 4 bits per channel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.A8
member.summary: 8-bit alpha only.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.A8P8
member.summary: An 8-bit format, color-indexed with 8 bits of alpha.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.A8R3G3B2
member.summary: A 16-bit ARGB texture format that uses 8 bits for alpha, 3 bits each for red and green, and 2 bits for blue.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.A8R8G8B8
member.summary: A 32-bit ARGB pixel format, with alpha, that uses 8 bits per channel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.D15S1
member.summary: A 16-bit z-buffer bit depth that reserves 15 bits for the depth channel and 1 bit for the stencil channel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.D16
member.summary: A 16-bit z-buffer bit depth.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.D24S8
member.summary: A 32-bit z-buffer bit depth that uses 24 bits for the depth channel and 8 bits for the stencil channel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.D24X4S4
member.summary: A 32-bit z-buffer bit depth that uses 24 bits for the depth channel and 4 bits for the stencil channel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.D24X8
member.summary: A 2-bit z-buffer bit depth that uses 24 bits for the depth channel.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.D32
member.summary: A 32-bit z-buffer bit depth.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.Dxt1
member.summary: DXT1 compression texture format.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.Dxt2
member.summary: DXT2 compression texture format.

member.summary: DXT4 compression texture format.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.Dxt5
member.summary: DXT5 compression texture format.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.Index16
member.summary: 16-bit index buffer format.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.Index32
member.summary: 32-bit index buffer format.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.P8
member.summary: An 8-bit format, color-indexed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.R3G3B2
member.summary: An 8-bit RGB texture format that uses 3 bits for red, 3 bits for green, and 2 bits for blue.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format.R5G6B5

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.LightType.Directional
member.summary: This light source is directional and is attached to a frame but appears to illuminate all objects with equal intensity, as if it were at an infinite distance from the objects. Directional light has orientation but no position, and it is commonly used to simulate distant light sources, such as the sun.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.LightType.Point
member.summary: This light is a point source. The light has a position in space and radiates light in all directions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.LockFlags
member.summary: Defines the type of lock to perform.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.LockFlags.Discard
member.summary: The application overwrites every location within the region being locked, using a write-only operation. This is a valid option when using dynamic textures, dynamic vertex buffers, and dynamic index buffers.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.LockFlags.NoDirtyUpdate
member.summary: By default, a lock on a resource adds a dirty region to that resource. This flag prevents any changes to the dirty state of the resource. Applications should use this flag when they have additional information about the set of regions changed during the lock operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.LockFlags.None
member.summary: The application may read and write to and from the buffer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.LockFlags.NoOverwrite
member.summary: The application is guaranteed not to overwrite any data in the vertex and index buffers. This flag allows the driver to return immediately and continue rendering, using this vertex buffer. If the flag is not used, the driver must finish rendering before returning from locking.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.LockFlags.ReadOnly
member.summary: The application does not write to the buffer. This flag enables resources stored in non-native formats to save the recompression step when unlocking.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Manager.CheckDeviceType(System.Int32,Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.DeviceType,Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format,Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Format,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies whether a hardware-accelerated device type can be used on the current adapter.
member.returns: true if the method succeeds and the device can be used on this adapter; otherwise, false.
member.param: Member of the enumeration that identifies the device type.
Ordinal number that denotes the display adapter to query. is always the primary display adapter.
Member of the enumeration that indicates the format of the adapter display mode for which the device type is being checked. For example, some devices operate only in modes of 16 bits per pixel.

Back buffer format. For more information about formats, see Format. This value must be one of the render target formats. The property of a can be used to obtain the current format. For windowed applications, the back buffer format does not need to match the display mode format if the hardware supports color conversion. The set of possible back buffer formats is constrained, but the runtime allows any valid back buffer format to be presented to any desktop format. Additionally, the device must be operable in desktop mode because devices typically do not operate in modes of 8 bits per pixel.Full-screen applications cannot perform color conversion. You can specify of the for windows mode.
Set to true to inquire about windowed multisampling. Set to false to inquire about full-screen multisampling.

member.summary: Specifies a novelty font; for example, Old English.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PitchAndFamily.FamilyDoNotCare

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PitchAndFamily.FamilyModern
member.summary: Specifies a monospace font with or without serifs. Monospace fonts are usually modern; examples include Pica, Elite, and Courier New.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PitchAndFamily.FamilyRoman
member.summary: Specifies a proportional font with serifs; for example, Times New Roman.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PitchAndFamily.FamilyScript
member.summary: Specifies a font that is designed to look like handwriting; for example, Script and Cursive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PitchAndFamily.FamilySwiss
member.summary: Specifies a proportional font without serifs; for example, Arial.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PitchAndFamily.FixedPitch
member.summary: Specifies a monospace font with or without serifs. Monospace fonts are usually modern; examples include Pica, Elite, and Courier New.

member.summary: Specifies a variable-pitch font.

member.summary: Specifies any reasonable font.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Precision.Raster
member.summary: When more than one font has a given name, use the raster font if available.

member.summary: Specifies a font with a size (height and width) that most closely matches the requested size. The driver may disregard the requested orientation and escapement, but other attributes must match.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PresentFlag
member.summary: Defines flags that control a operation for a .

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PresentFlag.LockableBackBuffer
member.summary: Informs the driver that the back buffers contain video data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PresentFlag.None
member.summary: Use no presentation flags.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PresentInterval
member.summary: Defines flags that describe the relationship between the adapter refresh rate and the rate at which the operations are completed for a .

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PresentInterval.Default
member.summary: Equivalent to setting .

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PresentInterval.Four
member.summary: The driver waits for the vertical retrace period. operations are not affected more frequently than every fourth screen refresh. Check the property to determine whether the driver supports this option.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PresentInterval.Immediate
member.summary: The runtime updates the window client area immediately, and might do so more than once during the adapter refresh period. operations might be affected immediately. This option is always available for both windowed and full-screen swap chains.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PresentInterval.One
member.summary: The driver waits for the vertical retrace period (the runtime will beam trace to prevent tearing). operations are not affected more frequently than the screen refresh rate; the runtime completes one operation per adapter refresh period, at most. This option is always available for both windowed and full-screen swap chains.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PresentInterval.Three
member.summary: The driver waits for the vertical retrace period. operations are not affected more frequently than every third screen refresh. Check the property to determine whether the driver supports this option.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PresentInterval.Two
member.summary: The driver waits for the vertical retrace period. operations are not affected more frequently than every second screen refresh. Check the property to determine whether the driver supports this option.

member.summary: Defines the primitives supported by Direct3D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PrimitiveType.LineList
member.summary: Renders the vertices as a list of isolated straight line segments. Calls that use this primitive type fail if the count is less than two or is odd.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PrimitiveType.LineStrip
member.summary: Renders the vertices as a single polyline. Calls that use this primitive type fail if the count is less than two.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PrimitiveType.PointList
member.summary: Renders the vertices as a collection of isolated points. This value is unsupported for indexed primitives.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PrimitiveType.TriangleFan
member.summary: Renders the vertices as a triangle fan.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PrimitiveType.TriangleList
member.summary: Renders the specified vertices as a sequence of isolated triangles. Each group of three vertices defines a separate triangle. Back face culling is affected by the current winding-order render state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.PrimitiveType.TriangleStrip
member.summary: Renders the vertices as a triangle strip. The back face culling flag is flipped automatically on even-numbered triangles.

member.summary: Defines constants that describe the supported shading modes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.ShadeMode.Flat
member.summary: Flat shading mode. The color and specular component of the first vertex in the triangle are used to determine the color and specular component of the face. These colors remain constant across the triangle; that is, they are not interpolated. The specular alpha is interpolated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.ShadeMode.Gouraud
member.summary: The Gouraud shading mode. The color and specular components of the face are determined by a linear interpolation between all three of the triangle's vertices.

member.summary: Enables alpha blending with set to true (for nonzero alpha). is the source blend state, and is the destination blend state in calls to . The class requires this flag to be set when drawing text.

member.summary: Rotates each sprite around its center so that it is facing the viewer. or must be called first.

member.summary: Specifies no changes to the device render state when is called.

member.summary: Prevents the device state from being saved or restored when or is called.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.SpriteFlags.None
member.summary: Resolves the value to 0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.SpriteFlags.ObjectSpace
member.summary: Specifies no modification of the world, view, and projection transforms. The transforms currently set to the device are used to transform sprites when the batched sprites are drawn (that is, when or is called). If this option is not specified, the world, view, and projection transforms are modified so that sprites are drawn in screen-space coordinates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.SpriteFlags.SortDepthBackToFront
member.summary: Sorts sprites by depth in back-to-front order prior to drawing. This option is recommended when drawing transparent sprites of varying depths.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.SpriteFlags.SortDepthFrontToBack
member.summary: Sorts sprites by depth in front-to-back order prior to drawing. This option is recommended when drawing opaque sprites of varying depths.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.SpriteFlags.SortTexture
member.summary: Sorts sprites by texture prior to drawing. This option is recommended when drawing non-overlapping sprites of uniform depth; for example, drawing screen-aligned text with .

member.summary: Specifies whether the bits in the stencil buffer entry can be inverted.

member.summary: Specifies whether to keep the stencil buffer entry unmodified or allow it to be updated.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.SwapEffect
member.summary: Defines swap effects.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.SwapEffect.Copy
member.summary: This swap effect can be specified only for a swap chain that comprises a single back buffer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.SwapEffect.CopyVSync
member.summary: This swap effect behaves like the Copy swap effect except that it synchronizes the copy with the vertical retrace of the monitor so that tearing artifacts are eliminated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.SwapEffect.Discard
member.summary: When a swap chain is created with a swap effect of or , the runtime guarantees that a operation of a will not affect the content of any of the back buffers. However, meeting this guarantee can involve substantial video memory or processing overheads, especially when implementing flip semantics for a windowed swap chain or copy semantics for a full-screen swap chain.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.SwapEffect.Flip
member.summary: The swap chain might include multiple back buffers and is essentially a circular queue that includes the front buffer. Within this queue, the back buffers are always numbered sequentially from 0 to (n - 1), where n is the number of back buffers, so that 0 denotes the least recently presented buffer.

Width of the texture's top level, in pixels. The pixel dimensions of subsequent levels are the truncated value of half of the previous level's pixel dimension (independently). Each dimension clamps at a size of one pixel. Thus, if the division by 2 results in 0, 1 is taken instead.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureAddress.Border
member.summary: Texture coordinates outside the range [0.0, 1.0] are set to the border color.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureAddress.Clamp
member.summary: Texture coordinates outside the range [0.0, 1.0] are set to the texture color at 0.0 or 1.0, respectively.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureAddress.Mirror
member.summary: Similar to , except that the texture is flipped at every integer junction. For u values between 0 and 1, for example, the texture is addressed normally; between 1 and 2, the texture is flipped (mirrored); between 2 and 3, the texture is normal again, and so on.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureAddress.Wrap
member.summary: Tiles the texture at every integer junction. For example, for u values between 0 and 3, the texture is repeated three times. No mirroring is performed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureArgument
member.summary: Defines the supported texture arguments.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureArgument.AlphaReplicate
member.summary: Replicate the alpha value to the color components. During sampling, this value acts as a read modifier.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureArgument.Complement
member.summary: Take the complement, or 1.0 - x. This is a read modifier.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureArgument.Current
member.summary: Gets the current element in the collection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureArgument.Diffuse
member.summary: Specifies the diffuse color interpolated from vertex components during Gouraud shading. If the vertex does not contain a diffuse color, the default color is 0xFFFFFFFF. Permissions are read-only.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureArgument.OptionMask
member.summary: Mask for option bits. These are the and flags.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureArgument.SelectMask
member.summary: Mask value for all arguments; not used when setting texture arguments.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureArgument.Specular
member.summary: Specifies the specular color interpolated from vertex components during Gouraud shading. If the vertex does not contain a specular color, the default color is 0xFFFFFFFF. Permissions are read-only.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureArgument.Temp
member.summary: Specifies a temporary register color for read or write. This field is supported if the value for a is present. The default value for the register is (0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0). Permissions are read/write.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureArgument.TextureColor
member.summary: Contains the texture color for the current texture stage. Permissions are read-only.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureArgument.TFactor
member.summary: Specifies the texture factor set in the property. Permissions are read-only.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCaps
member.summary: Contains miscellaneous texture-mapping capabilities.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCaps.SupportsAlpha
member.summary: Specifies whether alpha in texture pixels is supported.
member.returns: true if alpha in texture pixels is supported; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCaps.SupportsAlphaPalette
member.summary: Specifies whether the device can draw alpha from texture palettes.
member.returns: true if the device can draw alpha from texture palettes; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCaps.SupportsMipMap
member.summary: Specifies whether the device supports mipmapped textures.
member.returns: true if the device supports mipmapped textures; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCaps.SupportsPerspective
member.summary: Specifies whether perspective correction texturing is supported.
member.returns: true if perspective correction texturing is supported; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCaps.SupportsPower2
member.summary: Specifies whether the device supports all textures having widths and heights that are specified as powers of two.
member.returns: true if the device supports texture dimensions as powers of two; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCaps.SupportsProjected
member.summary: Specifies whether is supported.
member.returns: true if is supported; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCaps.SupportsProjectedSupport
member.summary: Indicates whether projective texture divides are available.
member.returns: true if projective texture divides are available; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCaps.SupportsSquareOnly
member.summary: Specifies whether all textures must be square.
member.returns: true if all textures are required to be square; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCoordinateIndex
member.summary: Defines the supported texture coordinate index values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCoordinateIndex.CameraSpaceNormal
member.summary: Uses the vertex normal, transformed to camera space, as the input texture coordinates for the current stage's texture transformation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCoordinateIndex.CameraSpacePosition
member.summary: Uses the vertex position, transformed to camera space, as the input texture coordinates for the current stage's texture transformation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCoordinateIndex.CameraSpaceReflectionVector
member.summary: Uses the reflection vector, transformed to camera space, as the input texture coordinate for the current stage's texture transformation. The reflection vector is computed from the input vertex position and normal vector.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCoordinateIndex.PassThru
member.summary: Uses the specified texture coordinates contained in the vertex format. This value resolves to 0.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureFilter
member.summary: Defines texture filtering modes for a texture stage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureFilter.Anisotropic
member.summary: Anisotropic texture filtering used as a texture magnification or minification filter. This type of filtering compensates for distortion caused by the difference in angle between the texture polygon and the plane of the screen.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureFilter.Linear
member.summary: Bilinear interpolation filtering used as a texture magnification or minification filter. A weighted average of a 2x2 area of texels (single pixel texture elements) surrounding the desired pixel is used. The texture filter used between mipmap levels is trilinear mipmap interpolation, in which the rasterizer performs linear interpolation on pixel color, using the texels of the two nearest mipmap textures.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureFilter.None
member.summary: Mipmapping disabled. The rasterizer uses the magnification filter instead.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureFilter.Point
member.summary: Point filtering used as a texture magnification or minification filter. The texel with coordinates nearest to the desired pixel value is used. The texture filter used between mipmap levels is based on the nearest point; that is, the rasterizer uses the color from the texel of the nearest mipmap texture.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation
member.summary: Defines per-stage texture-blending operations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.Add
member.summary: Subtracts the components of the second argument from those of the first argument.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.AddSigned
member.summary: Adds the components of the arguments with a -0.5 bias, making the effective range of values -0.5 through 0.5.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.AddSigned2X
member.summary: Adds the components of the arguments with a -0.5 bias and shifts the products 1 bit to the left.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.AddSmooth
member.summary: Adds the first and second arguments, then subtracts their product from the sum.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.BlendCurrentAlpha
member.summary: Performs linear blending on the current texture stage, using the alpha taken from the previous texture stage.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.BlendDiffuseAlpha
member.summary: Performs linear blending on the current texture stage, using the interpolated alpha from each vertex.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.BlendFactorAlpha
member.summary: Performs linear blending on the current texture stage, using a scalar alpha set with the property for a .

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.BlendTextureAlpha
member.summary: Performs linear blending on the current texture stage, using the interpolated alpha from each vertex.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.BlendTextureAlphaPM
member.summary: Performs linear blending on the current texture stage that uses a premultiplied alpha.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.Disable
member.summary: Disables output from the texture stage and all stages with a higher index. To disable texture mapping, set this flag as the color operation for the first texture stage (stage 0). Alpha operations cannot be disabled when color operations are enabled. Setting the alpha operation to when color blending is enabled causes undefined behavior.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.DotProduct3
member.summary: Modulates the components of each argument as signed components, adds their products, and replicates the sum to all color channels, including alpha. This operation is supported for color and alpha operations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.Lerp
member.summary: Performs linear interpolation between the second and third source arguments by a proportion specified in the first source argument.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.Modulate
member.summary: Multiplies the components of the arguments.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.Modulate2X
member.summary: Multiplies the components of the arguments, then shifts the products 1 bit to the left (effectively multiplying them by 2) for brightening.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.Modulate4X
member.summary: Multiplies the components of the arguments, then shifts the products 2 bits to the left (effectively multiplying them by 4) for brightening.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.ModulateAlphaAddColor
member.summary: Modulates the color of the second argument using the alpha of the first argument, then adds the result to argument one. This operation is supported only by using the property of a .

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.ModulateColorAddAlpha
member.summary: Modulates the arguments, then adds the alpha of the first argument. This operation is supported only by using the property of a .

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.ModulateInvAlphaAddColor
member.summary: Similar to , but uses the inverse of the alpha of the first argument. This operation is supported only by using the property of a .

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.ModulateInvColorAddAlpha
member.summary: Similar to ModulateColorAddAlpha, but uses the inverse of the color of the first argument. This operation is supported only by using the property of a .

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.MultiplyAdd
member.summary: Performs a multiply-accumulate operation, in which this field multiplies the last two arguments, adds them to the remaining input/source argument, and places that into the result.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.PreModulate
member.summary: This flag is set in stage n, the output of which is arg1. If stage n + 1 contains a texture, then the value of a is premultiplied by that texture.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.SelectArg1
member.summary: Uses this texture stage's first color or alpha argument, unmodified, as the output. This operation affects the color and alpha arguments used with the and properties of a , respectively.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.SelectArg2
member.summary: Uses this texture stage's second color or alpha argument, unmodified, as the output. This operation affects the color and alpha arguments used with the and properties of a , respectively.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureOperation.Subtract
member.summary: Subtracts the components of the second argument from those of the first argument.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureTransform.Projected
member.summary: All texture coordinates are divided by the last element before being passed to the rasterizer. For example, if this flag is specified with the flag, the first and second texture coordinates are divided by the third coordinate before being passed to the rasterizer.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Usage
member.summary: Defines supported usage types for the current resource.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Usage.DoNotClip
member.summary: Indicates that the vertex buffer content will never require clipping. When rendering with buffers that have this flag set, the property for a must be set to false.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Usage.Dynamic
member.summary: Indicates that the vertex buffer requires dynamic memory use, which is useful for drivers because it enables them to determine where to place the buffer. In general, static vertex buffers are placed in video memory and dynamic vertex buffers are placed in accelerated graphics port (AGP) memory. Note that there is no separate static use. If is not specified, the vertex buffer is made static.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Usage.Lockable
member.summary: Indicates that the resource is lockable.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Usage.None
member.summary: Specifies no usage type for the current resource.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Usage.RenderTarget
member.summary: Specifies that the resource will be a render target.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Usage.Texture
member.summary: Indicates that the resource can be used as a texture.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsMobile.DirectX.Direct3D.Usage.WriteOnly
member.summary: Informs the system that the application writes only to the vertex buffer. Using this flag enables the driver to choose the best memory location, which results in efficient write operations and rendering. Attempts to read from a vertex buffer created with this capability will fail.

member.param: Member of the enumerated type that describes a valid memory class in which to place the resource.

Usage can be 0, which indicates no usage value. However, if usage is desired, use a combination of one or more flags. It is good practice to match the usage parameter in the constructor with the behavior flags in the constructor. See Remarks.

Size of the vertex buffer in bytes. If vertexFormat is set to 0, sizeOfBufferInBytes must be large enough to contain at least one vertex, but it need not be a multiple of the vertex size. If vertexFormat is not set to 0, sizeOfBufferInBytes is not validated. See Remarks.
The object to associate with the vertex buffer.
Combination of flags that describe the vertex format of the vertices in the buffer.
member.exception: Direct3D could not allocate sufficient memory to complete the call.
